comments.body:
don't need var `newEmptyFileName`.  Instead:
`volumeFiles = []string{fmt.Sprintf("/mnt/volume1/%v_1.txt", ns)}`
or, just pass above []string directly to `createAndVerifyFilesOnVolume`
If you agree please replace all occurrences of this pattern below...
for the first call of createAndVerifyFilesOnVolume this is ok. but for second call we want to create new file and also want check previously created files from another pod.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +104,108 @@		// Create empty files on the mounted volumes on the pod to verify volume is writable
		// Verify newly and previously created files present on the volume mounted on the pod
		newEmptyFileName := fmt.Sprintf("/mnt/volume1/%v_1.txt", ns)
		volumeFiles = append(volumeFiles, newEmptyFileName)
		createAndVerifyFilesOnVolume(ns, pod.Name, []string{newEmptyFileName}, volumeFiles)

comments.body:
Ditto. L197-202 can be simplified as:
```
volumeFiles = []string{
     fmt.Sprintf("/mnt/volume1/%v_2.txt", ns),
     fmt.Sprintf("/mnt/volume2/%v_2.txt", ns),
}
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +247,251 @@		}
		volumeFiles = append(volumeFiles, newEmptyFileNames[0])
		volumeFiles = append(volumeFiles, newEmptyFileNames[1])
		createAndVerifyFilesOnVolume(ns, pod.Name, newEmptyFileNames, volumeFiles)
		deletePodAndWaitForVolumeToDetach(f, c, pod, vsp, node1Name, volumePaths)

comments.body: maybe a comment here about why you cannot use `SkipUnlessNodeCountIsAtLeast`?

`e2e.go -> setupProviderConfig() `does not read test config for vsphere provider. vsphere tests are executed as conformance tests without setting --provider flag

```
export KUBERNETES_CONFORMANCE_PROVIDER="vsphere"
export KUBERNETES_CONFORMANCE_TEST=Y
```

~~Why use a defer here vs. an AfterEach?~~
Never mind. I see that a BeforeEach cannot be used inside an `It`

			framework.DeletePodWithWait(f, c, podA)

comments.body: podA and podB will be the value of the last pods in the `for` loop below, which also deletes these pods. I don't see why you want to delete just these 2 pods a second time here vs. deleting the entire slice of pods (podAFiles, podBFiles)?

Test just creates two pods - podA and podB. 
`podAFiles` and `podBFiles` contains set of empty files created in the volumes mounted on these pods. used for verification of the volume content.
OK, I see that you do not have a slice of pods, so you can ignore my comment above.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +278,282 @@		defer func() {
			By("clean up undeleted pods")
			framework.DeletePodWithWait(f, c, podA)
			framework.DeletePodWithWait(f, c, podB)
			By(fmt.Sprintf("wait for volumes to be detached from the node: %v", node1Name))
